edu.unl.abbot.vicar.Core

Class Vicar

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.avalon.framework.logger.AbstractLogEnabled
      • org.apache.cocoon.xml.AbstractXMLProducer
        • org.apache.cocoon.generation.AbstractGenerator
          • org.apache.cocoon.generation.ServiceableGenerator
            • edu.unl.abbot.vicar.Core.Vicar
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.apache.avalon.excalibur.pool.Poolable, org.apache.avalon.excalibur.pool.Recyclable, org.apache.avalon.framework.activity.Disposable, org.apache.avalon.framework.component.Component, org.apache.avalon.framework.logger.LogEnabled, org.apache.avalon.framework.service.Serviceable, org.apache.cocoon.generation.Generator, org.apache.cocoon.sitemap.SitemapModelComponent, org.apache.cocoon.xml.XMLProducer

    public class Vicar
extends org.apache.cocoon.generation.ServiceableGenerator
implements org.apache.avalon.framework.activity.Disposable
    Generator which implements the collections structure in a unix directory and provides a way for the user to invoke Abbot. Allows creation of individual collections. Allows user to upload files, uncompress if necessary, convert the files using Abbot, and then download them. If necessary the user can compress the files before download. This generator also handles single file uploads delivered by the upload form when javascript is not enabled by the browser. (File uploads are otherwise handled by Server.Upload.AjaxServer.)
    Version:
    0.8, 12/15/2012
    Author:
    Frank Smutniak, Center for Digital Research in the Humanities, http://cdrh.unl.edu

        public java.lang.String createDir(java.lang.String the_dirpath)

      • renameDir

        public java.lang.String renameDir(java.lang.String the_dirpath,
                         java.lang.String the_oldname,
                         java.lang.String the_newname)
        Rename a user collection. The default internal name for a new collection is 'NEW' and it must be renamed before it can be used.
        Parameters:
        the_dirpath - The path where the user collection resides.
        the_oldname - The existing name of the collection.
        the_newname - The user selected name of the collection.
        Returns:
        The name of the path of the new collection.

      • isDir

        public boolean isDir(java.lang.String the_dirpath)
        Check that a particular path points to a directory.
        Parameters:
        the_dirpath - The path to be checked.
        Returns:
        A boolean value of true if the path is an existing directory and false if it is not.

      • listDirs

        public java.util.Vector<FileData> listDirs(java.lang.String the_dirpath)
        List the user collections at the specified path. This is used for listing the collections held by a particular user.
        Parameters:
        the_dirpath - The path where the files reside.
        Returns:
        A Vector of FileData objects pertaining to the collections.

      • removeDir

        public java.lang.String removeDir(java.lang.String the_dirpath)
        Remove the specified directory and it's contents. The depth of the directory structure is fixed and known so a recursive implementation is unnecessary.
        Parameters:
        the_dirpath - The path where the files reside.
        Returns:
        The path which has been removed.
